title: What are some concepts or products that were invented in early China but not attributed to them? - Quora

response.answer_text: Government Exams (first copied by the British East India Company)Tea (stolen)Pasta (brought home by Marco Polo)Magnetic CompassBellsPaper CurrencyToothbrushPage-ranking algorithm (by future Baidu founder which inspired google’s PageRank, it’s even referenced in the patent, although this was in the US)Endless power-transmission (basically the mechanism you see on bicycles)Golf (the origin of modern golf is unclear but an early version was first created in China)Football (ironic given China’s performance)Gunpowder (ironically created in the search for immortality)Coke (energy source, not the drink or narcotic)CrankshaftCrossbowDrilling Rig (adopted for oil extraction but first invented for gas)Probably many others but these are the ones I’m aware of with high relevance for the modern world. (I guess not Crossbows but they are relevant for movies)
